title.native: 疾風！ アイアンリーガー

description:
In the future, mankind has developed a multi-sport tournament known as Iron League, using artificially intelligent robots as the players instead of humans. The competition is very popular. However, its main support comes from the Dark Organization, a group that produces cheating Iron Leaguers that use dirty and violent tactics in games as a sure ticket for fame and popularity. While the sports community has been turned into a dangerous and (figuratively) bloody contest, Silver Castle, the team with the lowest winning ratio, tries to preserve true sportsmanship by playing sports by their original rules without any cheating or violence. The team's fate as well as the fate of the Iron League itself is changed when two Iron Leaguers - Mach Windy, Dark Prince FC's former ace striker and Magnum Ace, a mysterious but skillful baseball-playing Leaguer - join Silver Castle, and gradually lead the team back to its forgotten glory. It's not all fun and games, however; as the story goes on, it is revealed that the Iron League is actually a front for something far more sinister...

(Source: TV Tropes)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chikichikiko) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chikichikiko/) | [Blog](https://okiayuryotaro.jugem.jp/)

Married to [Ai Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/95487). Previously married to [Nao Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/96037) with whom he has a daughter.
Husband of voice actress [Junko Sakuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111433).

[Website](http://www.kaoru-wada.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaoru_wadash) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4zbQfESCpBlXi1XlpnlG95)

He is a Japanese music composer. Married to voice actress [Akiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95749/Akiko-Nakagawa).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/staffwhy)

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Older brother of [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/).

He is known for having reached great expertise in many techniques from realistic animation to digital compositing. This gives him the ability to have full control over his works, often being responsible for the key frames, in-betweens, finishing, photography and backgrounds of the scenes he is in charge of.

His skilled use of coloring and compositing, together with the realistic depiction of movement make his works to be often mistaken for computer generated animation.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Ghost in the Shell (Video Game, 1997) (OP Key Animation)
- Tales of Phantasia (Video Game, 1998) (Cutscene Director, Animation Director, Key Animation)
- Valkyrie Profile Series (Video Game, 1999-2008) (Character Design, Art Design) 
- Kafu ~Kono Shirabe ga Kimi ni Todokimasu You ni~ (Visual Novel, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography, CG Animation)
- Sakura Wars 3: Paris is Burning? (Video Game, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-Between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Akiiro Renka (Visual Novel, 2005) (OP Director, Animation Character Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Muv-Luv Alternative (Visual Novel, 2006) (Cutscene Mecha Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography) !~

[Blog](http://aminon.asablo.jp/blog/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%83%8E%E3%83%86%E3%83%84%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsur%C5%8D_Amino)

Tetsurou Amino is a Japanese director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

In 1988, he started using his name in katakana.
He passed away from undisclosed causes in January 2020.

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.

Originating from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Kunio Okawara was the first in the industry to be specifically credited as a mechanical designer. He is the designer of numerous Real Robots and Super Robots.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大畑清隆)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大畑清隆)

[Website](http://www.chisa-club.com/) | [Blog](http://chisa-club.cocolog-nifty.com/)

She co-hosts an ongoing radio show with fellow seiyū Kappei Yamaguchi and Sakura Wars creator Ōji Hiroi. She is founder and head of her own voice company called Banbina after leaving Arts Vision. When she was a high school student, she was an assistant of Jump Broadcasting Station of Weekly Shonen Jump (1988-1996). She is most known for the roles of Sasami Masaki Jurai (Tenchi Muyo!), Lucrezia Noin (Mobile Suit Gundam Wing) and Sakura Shinguji (Sakura Wars)

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.
Started his career at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1963. Later went freelance to further pursue his career as a scriptwriter.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/123099499)

[Blog](http://aminon.asablo.jp/blog/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%83%8E%E3%83%86%E3%83%84%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsur%C5%8D_Amino)

Tetsurou Amino is a Japanese director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

In 1988, he started using his name in katakana.

Junji Nishimura is a male Japanese director, an episode director and storyboarder from Yobuko, Saga, Japan, though he currently resides in Karatsu, Saga. After graduating from Meiji Gakuin University in 1980, Nishimura entered into the anime studio Nishiko Production. Nishimura had his first job as an episode director for Baldios in 1980, and went on to be an episode director in other series such as Six God Combination Godmars, and Magical Princess Minky Momo in 1982. In 1984, he resigned from Nishiko and in 1985 had his director debut with Pro Golfer Saru. Since then, he has worked as the director on many anime produced by Studio Deen and later on for Seven Arcs.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/8tabe5817) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katsuyoshi_Yatabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷田部勝義)

Yatabe Katsuyoshi is a Japanese screenwriter and director.     

After graduating he joined the Department of Arts at Nihon Daigaku in 1975. In 1978 he joined Ad Cosmo but felt that as subcontractor there would be no real productions done and thus went on to join Sunrise in 1979. There he learned under [Tomino Yoshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/97337) and [Takahashi Ryousuke](https://anilist.co/staff/100957) before becoming freelancer.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/今西隆志)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/772463158506106881)

Akane worked at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) for the first 15 years of his career. There he collaborated with [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/) to direct his most famous work, [Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/). After having left Sunrise in 2000, he joined [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/), where he created and directed the shows [Geneshaft](https://anilist.co/anime/909/), [HeatGuy J](https://anilist.co/anime/958/), and the most famous of the three, [Noein: To Your Other Self](https://anilist.co/anime/584/).

Since then Akane has gone freelance. His more recent works include [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/) and [Stars Align](https://anilist.co/anime/104052/).
